Summary My work assists FM Global in its mission of helping Clients remain resilient against property loss.  
 
To this end, I manage groups responsible for FM Global’s enterprise data warehouse, data administration and analysis, and Cognos business intelligence. I also play the role of project manager for cross-functional teams on business intelligence projects using Microsoft Power BI. 
 
Through my twenty-year career, I have contributed to and led projects in the areas of insurance-related engineering and underwriting (property and excess/surplus), bank-owned leasing, utilities, direct commerce and paper-products manufacturing. More recently, at FM Global, I have led information technology projects in the areas of engineering, reinsurance, account management, underwriting, and mid-market insurance.  
 
My technical areas of expertise are project management and business analysis, most recently for data warehousing and business intelligence projects. In the past, I have been a software engineer, data warehouse designer, and Unix system administrator. I am certified as a Project Management Professional (PMP).

Summary At the center of the data storm generated by a $16 billion company serving 75 million customers at 22,000 stores in 66 countries, one cup at a time.  
 
I lead the Customer Analytics Modeling & Data Science team, supporting the My Starbucks Rewards loyalty program to drive the acquisition and engagement of our 10 million active members. 
 
I am a lifelong learner, with a career spanning Software Engineering, Business Intelligence / Data Warehousing, and Predictive Analytics. I enjoy bringing coding skills, business acumen, and math together to help leaders make better business decisions.  
 
A former instructor and Northwest Chapter President at The Data Warehousing Institute, my research interests include high-performance and parallel computing, machine learning, ensemble methods, automated feature selection, and reproducible research.
